results.title: Head over heels
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Robert Simonds and Mark Waters
results.brief_description: Australian supermodel Sarah O’Hare makes her acting debut as one of four models to share a plush Manhatten apartment with our protagonist, Amanda (Monica Potter). Single Amanda is cursed with dating the wrong men and when she spots handsome Jim Winston (Freddie Prinze Jr,) out her window - a man she met under curious circumstances in the lobby - she becomes instantly attracted and decidedly cautious. Under the guidance of her new flatmates, Amanda crashes a party at Jim’s and discovers he is almost too good to be true. Voyeurism wreaks havoc between the two soulmates when Amanda sees what she believes to be Jim committing a murder. When the police fail to locate a body she takes it upon herself to get to the bottom of the matter, ably assisted and hindered by her model friends. Cast also includes Ivana Milicevic, Shalom Harlow, Tomiko Fraser and China Chow.

results.title: Head On
results.creator_credit: Head On Productions, Jane Scott and Ana Kokkinos
results.brief_description: Ana Kokkinos’s debut follows the angry, confused and nihilistic 19-year-old Greek Australian, Ari (Alex Dimitriades) through 24 hours fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Head On Productions, Jane Scott and Ana Kokkinos
results.description:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.

results.title: He walked by night
results.creator_credit: Robert T Kane and Alfred L Werker
results.brief_description: In the suspenseful tradition of “The Naked City”, and drawn from the documented files of L.A.P.D. Homicide files, “He Walked by Night” is a first class suspense thriller about a desperate burglar who turns into a cop killer and is hounded down by the police. Richard Basehart is brilliant as the fearless fugitive.

results.title: He died with a felafel in his hand
results.creator_credit: Notorious Films, Andrew McPhail, Domenico Procacci and Richard Lowenstein
results.brief_description: Danny (Noah Taylor), onto his 49th share house and in his mid 30s is probably ready for some privacy and independence but is still attracted to the friends and oddball characters that makes sharing a house so attractively horrible. We travel with Danny as he moves through shared houses in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. Danny’s life is further complicated by the presence of rental goons despatched by landlords in search of unpaid rent and the police chasing him in relation to a credit card debt thanks to a dodgy housemate. Proving he is not responsible is harder than lying about his identity. Based on the book of the same name by John Birmingham, `He Died With A Felafel In His Hand’ is a wonderful satire on shared housing. Cast also includes Romane Bohringer, Emily Hamilton, Sophie Lee, Alex Menglet and Damien Walshe Howling.

results.title: Hatari
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Malabar Productions and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks reteams with John Wayne, who heads a group of highly skilled professional game hunters in Africa. They don’t use bullets, rather capturing the ferocious big game with rope and cameras for zoos and circus attractions, an exciting business that pits man against beast. “Hatari” means “danger” in Swahili and the fine cast of this spectacular adventure film also includes Hardy Kruger, Red Buttons and Elsa Martinelli and Gerard Blain.

results.title: Harum scarum
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sam Katzman and Gene Nelson
results.brief_description: The King’s 19th movie is shot on the original 1925 Cecil B DeMille set from “King of Kings” and features Elvis as matinee idol Johnny Tyrone. When Tyrone is kidnapped en route to the Middle Eastern premier of his latest film, he is launched into an Arabian Nights scenario, complete with chicks, sheikhs, a hostile political environment, and the obligatory damsel in distress (Mary Ann Mobley). He is also asked to take part in a plot to assassinate an Arab king. Features nine songs including “Harem holiday”, “Golden coins”, “Shake that tambourine” and “Go East young man”. Cast also includes Fran Jeffries, Michael Ansara and Jay Novello. The film is alleged to have been made within 18 days.

results.title: Harry Potter and the philosopher's stone [DVD]
results.creator_credit: 1492 Pictures, Heyday Films, David Heyman and Chris Columbus
results.brief_description: A stunning visual adaptation of the novel of the same name by British author J.K. Rowling. 10 year old Harry Potter, orphaned as an infant and raised by his horrible aunt and uncle, believes himself to be an ordinary boy, only to find out on his eleventh birthday that he is anything but ordinary. Harry is a wizard and has been accepted at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where he will spend the next seven years following in his parent’s footsteps. Spells, charms, potions, Quidditch - every young wizard’s favourite sport, dragons, trolls, three-headed dogs and discovering the truth behind his parent’s not-so-accidental death means never-ending adventures for Harry and his friends Hermione and Ron. Newcomers Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint star as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Cast also includes Richard Harris, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis.

results.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
results.creator_credit: 1492 Pictures, Heyday Films, Warner Bros Pictures, David Heyman and Chris Columbus
results.brief_description: A stunning visual adaptation of the novel of the same name by British author J.K. Rowling. Ten-year-old Harry Potter is anything but ordinary, he’s a wizard and has been accepted at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

results.title: Harry Potter and the chamber of secrets
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, David Heyman and Chris Columbus
results.brief_description: The second instalment in the Harry Potter series returns to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, in what is arguably a stronger film than its predecessor, despite belief that the novel on which the film is based, is the weakest in the series. An enchanting musical score and solid animation are supported by strong performances of young actors Daniel Radcliff, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint, who reprise their roles as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Between dealing with cryptic house-elves, flying cars, Quidditch, and attempting to keep one step ahead of the nasty Slytherins, who has time to study? However, when muggle-born students are being attacked, it is once again up to Harry and his friends to save the day. The all-star British cast includes Jason Isaacs as the malicious Lucius Malfoy and Kenneth Branagh as pompous professor Gilderoy Lockhart who join Richard Harris, in one of his final roles, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis.
